bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to William F. Wharton
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, November 11th, 1889

Mr. Ezekiel E. Smith
To the Department of State

Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, November 11th 1889.

Honorable William F. Wharton,
Assistant Secretary,
Washington, D.C.

I have the honor respectfully to state that in any requisition for supplies of stationery etc for this Legation and Consulate General, under date of October 26th 1889, I failed to request that a supply of despatch paper be included, which request I now beg to make, and hope that a supply of official despatch paper will be forwarded.

I am, sir,
Your obedient servant
Ezekiel E. Smith
U.S. Consul General
